programme.title: Spiky Gold Hunters
programme.desc: It’s all hands on deck as the divers work relentlessly to collect tonnes of urchin. But as the weather deteriorates, one of the crew gets a scare from below the surface..

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: A new recruit has to save a snowplough stuck in an icy river, while Colin's first job of the season forces him into an unfamiliar role that tests his leadership skills.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Danielle is set a stiff challenge, and Mike is desperate to buy a 1967 Ford Fairlane car.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz visit a farm in need of vital funds, before exploring a boarded-up cheese factory and an underground railroad site.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Lives are threatened by a weak cable at Browning, and an accident involving a stockpile of logs places Rygaard's only remaining rookie in danger.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Jimmy's nerves are tested by the threat of a large alligator, and a disaster ensues when the helicopter is overloaded.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick and the team renovate a 1940s chocolate dispenser to a tight deadline, before turning their attention to a 1950s fridge.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick Wade restores a toy train, but has to overcome various obstacles to keep the project on track, and a 1948 popcorn machine is spruced up.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: An investigation into whether advanced technologies, such as lasers and sonic weapons, are merely rediscovered tools used by advanced beings in the past.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The alleged existence of underground extraterrestrial lairs, concentrating on a cave in Ecuador said to hold alien knowledge, and a hidden city in Turkey.

programme.title: Monster Croc Wrangler
programme.desc: The team attempts to move 30 crocodiles away from local cattle in just one week.

programme.title: Monster Croc Wrangler
programme.desc: Time is running out as Matt and the boys continue their quest to catch 30 crocodiles in the Northern Territory's Mary River in just one week.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz head to Ohio to inspect the house of an auctioneer, before travelling to Indiana, where Frank falls in love with a Happy Days-inspired pinball machine.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz unearth a Schwinn motorbike and some BB guns, before taking a walk on the wild side to reach a valuable fireplace.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders face tough competition when they find themselves up against 100 rivals at an auction in Longview.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: The Good, the Bad and the Hungry
programme.desc: A locker belonging to a deceased tycoon goes up for auction, and all the bidders are determined to get their hands on its contents.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders attend an auction in Burelson, where they set out to find items of value among huge truckloads of strange oddities.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: Puffy in the Sky with Diamonds
programme.desc: Victor plans to get the better of the competition with some dirty tricks, while one of the teams buys a locker that could prove highly profitable.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: The Surgeon, the Witch and the Wardrobe
programme.desc: A locker auction in Texas is in the path of a tornado, so the bidders try to complete their purchases before the storm hits.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky and Bubba compete against Victor to buy a luxury household locker in an auction at Mineral Wells.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders attend an auction in Laguna Niguel, where Barry buys a mysterious safe with unknown contents and Jarrod and Brandi acquire a collection of toys.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry is accompanied by two beautiful women to the auction, while newcomers Rene and Casey purchase a statue that could be worth thousands of dollars. Elsewhere, a professional wrestler appears at an appraisal.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders attend a locker auction at El Monte, California, where Jarrod and Brandi find their sense of charity and Barry unearths a bag that has him hitting the slopes.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: In Compton, Mike buys something that Herb does not want to be anywhere near. Jarrod ends up with a new nickname while Barry and his old pal Kenny reunite.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell makes the most expensive purchase in the history of the series at an auction in Orange.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Casey and Rene buy a small, mysterious unit, and discover it contains a Wizard of Oz chess set.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod attends auctions in Mission Viejo and ends up with some unusual art on his hands. Barry's accountant tries to stop him from spending too much money.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell and Ivy battle it out at a locker auction in Lancaster, California, while Jarrod and Brandi buy some DJ equipment.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders attend an auction in Placentia, California, where Rene and Casey buy a locker full of luggage. Meanwhile, Barry is left pondering his future.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry adopts a disguise at an auction in Stanton, while Darrell gets himself banned from bidding.

programme.title: Spiky Gold Hunters
programme.desc: It’s all hands on deck as the divers work relentlessly to collect tonnes of urchin. But as the weather deteriorates, one of the crew gets a scare from below the surface..

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: Gus has his eye on a Citroen XM that looks amazing - but it's in France. Will isn't sure, but the engineering challenges win him over.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: Rick and Marty Lagina double down their efforts to locate the elusive Money Pit. A significant and unexpected discovery strengthens Oak Island's connection to the Knights Templar.

programme.title: Texas Rising
programme.desc: The Texas Revolution gathers pace as General Sam Houston's Texian troops look for revenge against the Mexican army led by General Santa Anna. Drama, starring Bill Paxton.

programme.title: Mountain Men
programme.desc: Marty brings out the big guns for a final frenzied push out of the brush. Morgan and Margaret make a major breakthrough, as Mike battles Kodiak's most treacherous mountain.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Actor David Harewood hosts an extended edition of the current affairs quiz, with comedian Josh Widdicombe and Newsnight presenter Kirsty Wark joining regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's events.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programme.desc: The comedian unveils a way to reduce the time it takes to listen to a song, and shares his thoughts on alternatives to food and books on naming babies.

programme.title: Alan Davies: As Yet Untitled
programme.desc: Jason Byrne, Denise Van Outen, Josh Widdicombe and Alice Levine join Alan to discuss such varied topics as acts of charity, stealing from the Royal Family and tough crowds.

programme.title: Alan Davies: As Yet Untitled
programme.desc: Charlie Higson, Sally Phillips, Johnny Vaughan and Ellie Taylor take their seats at the table with Alan to discuss such varied topics as Josh Hartnett and escapes from oil rigs.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim and Gendle become action sport film directors as they realise their dream of creating a Zombie vs Parkour chase scene.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: David Jason: Planes, Trains and Automobiles
programme.desc: The actor flies into the heart of a volcano, gets a surprise in a drag-racing car, hits the road with an American trucker and takes to the skies in a vintage Second World War plane.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A vast new island in the seas off Dubai, which has been created to house the world's biggest observation wheel - twice the size of the London Eye.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: This edition of the documentary series takes a look at the town of Sodom, which is thought to have existed in ancient Palestine.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the validity of the Bible's best-known stories. Two different theories about Moses' dramatic parting of the Red Sea are examined. The original Hebrew version of the Bible contains references to a 'reed sea' where it is thought the crossing may have occurred.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.sub-title: Tudor Parfitt & The Lost Tribes of Israel
programme.desc: The claims of British historian, writer, broadcaster and adventurer Professor Tudor Parfitt, who says he located an African tribe of Jews called the Lemba whose roots can be traced back to the Jews of the Old Testament.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: Documentary offering an insight into the staff of Moses, one of the more astonishing miracles depicted in the Bible as Moses turned his staff into a snake.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Laurence Olivier narrates this documentary chronicling events leading up to the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbour on December 7, 1941, and the subsequent collapse of unprepared British forces before the advancing enemy in Singapore. Includes interviews with veterans from both sides.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Factors influencing America's decision to support Britain during the Second World War, and how Hitler's declaration of war on the US convinced Congress to take more decisive action. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The battle for North Africa, which involved three years of fighting between Rommel's Afrika Korps and Montgomery's Desert Rats and culminated in the Allied victory at El Alamein. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How the myth of German invincibility was finally debunked by their defeat at the Battle of Stalingrad. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How German U-boats were used to disrupt the flow of goods from America across the Atlantic Ocean in an attempt to starve Britain into submission.

programme.title: The Queen's Castle
programme.desc: Documentary chronicling a year in the existence of 1,000-year-old Windsor Castle and its inhabitants, from the housekeeper and chefs to the Queen herself, who has allowed her public and private life to be documented more extensively than ever before. The state visit of former President of France Jacques Chirac sees the staff organise a banquet and a performance of a West End musical inside the building - but protesters outside threaten to mar proceedings.

programme.title: The Queen's Castle
programme.desc: The Knights of the Garter arrive at Windsor Castle for their annual lunch with members of the monarchy, which includes a complicated procession through the palace. The royal archives allow cameras to view nearly 200 years of photo albums, including the thousands of photographs from the Queen Mother's collection, and the castle clock-maker faces a race to ensure all 450 timepieces on the estate are turned back.

programme.title: The Queen's Castle
programme.desc: The Duke of Edinburgh, in his capacity as Ranger of the Great Park, takes a tour of Windsor's grounds and points out the modifications he has made during his tenure, including a deer park and a farm shop selling local produce. He then competes in the Royal Horse Show, which also features Prince Harry. Meanwhile, the Prince of Wales and the Duchess of Cornwall host a special banquet for the Prince's Trust.

programme.title: Secrets of the Manor House
programme.desc: Charles Spencer leads a tour of Althorp House, Northamptonshire, which was the childhood home of his sister Diana, Princess of Wales, and also her final resting place.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Nicholas Day explores the case of Edith Thompson, who conspired with her lover to murder her husband in 1922 - a story that inspired Alfred Hitchcock.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: A serial killer who terrorised London in 1942, using the chaos of the Blitz as an opportunity to attack women.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Part two of two. A re-examination of Jack the Ripper's crimes, revealing how the story known today was shaped by the sensationalist press of 1888. Featuring contributions from Ripper expert Donald Rumbelow and writer Hallie Rubenhold, author of The Five - the only book to tell the lives of the victims.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.sub-title: Desperate Doings in the Dungeon (aka The Rescue of Frau Kinkenrotten)
programme.desc: Herr Flick is imprisoned in General Von Klinkerhoffen's dungeon, leaving Rene to rescue him, and there is a plan afoot to micro-photograph Hitler's invasion plans.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: The Resistance plans to hide the million francs stolen from Herr Flick down Rene's trousers. Comedy, starring Gorden Kaye.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: General Von Klinkerhoffen tells Von Strohm and Gruber to catch and kill René for trying to poison a group of high German generals, while Michelle reveals her love for René.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Rene and the resistance attempt to smuggle the airmen back to England inside empty landmines, but Herr Flick and Von Smallhausen hide in the mines awaiting resistance members.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A 1970s Bond Bug three-wheeler divides opinion among Mathewsons customers, while a retired engineer reluctantly auctions off his late father's treasured 60s Jaguar Mark 2.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Ruins from the time before the fall of the Berlin Wall, including a covert Communist base that hid Cold War submarines for Tito and the former HQ of the Soviet Army in East Germany.

programme.title: Wallander
programme.desc: Anna Westin, a troubled childhood friend of Wallander's daughter, visits his house late at night begging for his help - but disappears soon afterwards. Meanwhile, an elderly woman's burned body is found in a shallow grave, and when the detective discovers a connection between Anna and the murder victim, he fears she could be the next target of a dangerous religious fanatic. Linda returns to Ystad to help with the investigation, and has life-changing news for her father. Guest starring Lindsay Duncan (Rome), with Kenneth Branagh and Jeany Spark.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: The barrister reluctantly agrees to act on behalf of a recently released jailbird accused of kidnapping his infant son, and gets caught up in a bitter tug-of-love battle. Returning home in search of solace, he clashes with daughter Kate over her growing independence - and finds himself forced to accept she is now a woman. John Thaw stars in the legal drama, with guest appearances by Dougray Scott and Toyah Willcox.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Brian struggles to control his urge to drink and finds refuge in a commune at the centre of the team's investigation into the death of a university student. The case also helps Gerry to face up to his relationship with Emily - who has not spoken to him since she discovered the truth about the DNA test at Ricky Hanson's trial. Police drama, starring Alun Armstrong and Amanda Redman.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: As the wedding day approaches, Evie feels it is time she met her in-laws, but Daniel's response is less than encouraging.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: The doctor is summoned by farmer's wife Mrs Henderson, who presents him with a puzzling case to solve involving her son, while Dr Cameron moves to his country cottage.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Tough former Met officer PC Roger Valentine joins the team and immediately makes a good impression by cracking down on muggings in the Sun Hill area - but his old-fashioned attitude toward homosexuality threatens to ruffle a few feathers when he's partnered with Lance. Jim continues to struggle with his gambling addiction and chilling CCTV footage of Abi makes Samantha fear for her daughter's safety.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Kerry Young's funeral casts a sombre shadow over Sun Hill as the team gather to pay their last respects to their colleague, but any hopes of a dignified send-off are dashed by an emotional outburst from Gabriel. Debt-ridden Jim fears an investigation into illegal goings-on at the greyhound track will expose his own complicity, while the close professional relationship between Jack and Debbie turns personal.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Debbie is assigned a major drugs investigation - much to Phil's irritation and Jim's alarm - but the chance to prove herself takes second place to family concerns when she learns her son has sustained internal bleeding from his fall. The bad news prompts her to hand in her resignation, leaving Jack wondering what the future holds for their relationship. Andrea tells Smithy that Gabriel raped Kerry, whose death continues to take its toll on the renegade copper.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Kerry's father visits Sun Hill to collect his murdered daughter's belongings, reopening old wounds for Smithy who begins to see Gabriel for the manipulative psychopath he is and threatens to officially accuse him of rape. Elsewhere, Gary thinks he's stumbled across a dismembered body - until Suzie points out the grisly remains are actually a collection of prosthetic limbs.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: The offer of a substantial reward inspires Hetty to find the bright spark behind a spate of arson attacks, and she begins by investigating the activities of a neighbour's foster daughter whose absences from home coincide with the fires. Housewife-detective series, starring Patricia Routledge, with Derek Benfield and Dominic Monaghan.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: The detectives find themselves swamped with work after their recent success. Hetty turns her attention to a troubled village, while Robert and Geoffrey embark on a case of their own. Private eye drama based on the novel by David Cook, starring Patricia Routledge and Derek Benfield.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Cinder Path
programme.desc: Drama about one man's journey through love and war in the early part of the century. Charlie MacFell returns from university to the family farm, where his strict father still rules with an iron fist _ a situation that soon changes thanks to a misunderstanding with a foolish farmhand. Lloyd Owen stars, with Catherine Zeta Jones, Tom Bell and Maria Mile.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns and midwives are busy preparing for Sister Evangelina's surprise jubilee celebrations, marking 50 years since she took her vows, but a face from the past threatens to ruin the party for the guest of honour. It's back to business when a young woman with Down's syndrome is brought in feeling unwell. To everyone's surprise, they discover she is six months pregnant, causing some of them to think the worst, and the staff are joined by new nurse Patsy, whose sense of humour and no-nonsense attitude make her an instant hit.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Trixie is chuffed when local curate Tom invites her to join him for a day of cricket, sending her to work with a spring in her step. Is love on the cards for the young midwife? Shelagh's infertility has made her think long and hard about what she wants in life, so she approaches her husband with an idea, while Patsy upsets a young mother in the clinic and is moved to the district rota, where she works tirelessly to diagnose a docker's unusual symptoms.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Gerry and the team agree to help a man who believes his wife is still alive, even though she apparently died 18 months earlier in a car accident. They decide the best way to convince him is to have her exhumed - only to be faced with more questions than answers when it turns out the body is not hers after all. Meanwhile, Brian needs to find a handyman when Esther bans him from his latest DIY project. Hugh Dennis and Samuel West guest star, with Amanda Redman.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: American diplomat Ryan Reed is shot dead and the team arrives at the scene to find his body posed - sitting upright on a bench with his hand tucked inside his jacket. An argument quickly ensues between the police and the US embassy, which claims the murder falls under its jurisdiction, while the Lyell crew fights against the bureaucracy of the FBI, aided only by the US deputy chief of mission Matt Garcia. However, when he goes missing, Nikki is concerned he might be the next target.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Part one of two. The body of a Falklands War veteran who became one of the leading lights in the campaign against nuclear weapons is found in a stretch of river running underneath the Ministry of Defence. As Boyd and the team set about investigating the man's former allies, they stumble upon footage of an incident intelligence services had tried to cover up - and Grace is reunited with a former lover from her own time in the anti-nuclear movement. Drama, starring Trevor Eve and Sue Johnston, with Jack Shepherd (Wycliffe, Into the Storm), John McArdle (Brookside) and Anna Chancellor (Four Weddings and a Funeral, Spooks).

programme.title: Horrible Bosses (2011)
programme.desc: A power-crazed bully, a sleazy cocaine addict and a sexual predator each make an employee's life a misery, but the three workers cannot afford to quit their jobs. They resort to desperate measures by conspiring to murder each other's bosses, with a little help from an eccentric ex-convict. Comedy, starring Jason Bateman, Charlie Day, Jason Sudeikis, Kevin Spacey, Jennifer Aniston and Colin Farrell.

programme.title: Teach My Pet to Do That
programme.desc: Animal lover, comedian and presenter Alexander Armstrong opens the doors of his multispecies pet training school, greeting Kevin the chow chow dog and Rambo the miniature New Zealand kunekune pig, to see if they can be taught to beg, spin and roll over. This week's star pet is Pudsey, the first dog to win Britain's Got Talent and which died recently. Plus, the show's trainers hit the road to see if they can train two chickens to play the world's most unusual game of Celebrity Guess Who by attempting to pick out the faces of Ant McPartlin and Katie Price from a constellation of stars.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: The Tracy brothers and their friends at International Rescue set out to foil the nefarious plots of the evil Hood. An updated remake of the classic 1960s marionette adventure series, this time featuring computer-animated characters on live-action modeled sets. With the voices of Rosamund Pike, Kayvan Novak and Thomas Brodie-Sangster, with the original Parker - David Graham - returning to voice Lady Penelope's long-serving chauffeur.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny's in Blackpool but is he brave enough to walk to the top of the UK's tallest rollercoaster?.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Madcap slapstick and mayhem as the celebrated cat and mouse plot against each other.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: A magician leaves behind his hat, and it creates magical mayhem for Tom, Jerry, and Spike.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Madcap slapstick and mayhem as the celebrated cat and mouse plot against each other.

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo mistakes Fizz for his best friend Harry from school, and thinks the two of them are visiting their old school..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean takes on the Bruisers at the local skateboard park, using only a mobility scooter..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The Spuds don't care about a carbon footprint, since George has come home with a haul of free electronics that they all want to test out..

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda: The Paws of Destiny
programme.desc: Mei Mei recruits Po and the students to perform in her new show, but things don't go to plan..

programme.title: Craig of the Creek
programme.desc: Craig of the Creek follows a young boy and his two friends as they go on adventures in a world of untamed, kid-dominated wilderness in the creek.

programme.title: Ainsley's Caribbean Kitchen
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott continues his tour of Jamaica, taking a trip into the Blue Mountains to learn the secrets of the region's famous coffee. He also visits one of the island's most acclaimed jerk chicken establishments and tries to get his hands on their secret recipe, before whipping up a mango and pineapple milkshake at famous hotel Jamaica Inn.

programme.title: Living on the Veg
programme.desc: Henry Firth and Ian Theasby serve up a plant-based lasagne, a vegan breakfast - including smoky barbecue beans, vegan scrambled eggs and a meat-free alternative to bacon - and salted caramel apple crumble with custard. The duo also try to convince meat-loving weatherman Alex Beresford that their big bosh burger is as good as the meaty ones he loves, and for their snack hacks, they show off their recipes for nut butters.

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: For the final leg of his journey, Gino D'Acampo takes a railway adventure to picturesque Lake Iseo, a hidden gem often overshadowed by its big sisters Garda and Como. He starts out angling for sardines, then takes his catch and prepares a dish of grilled fish for the passengers of Treno dei Sapore - a tourist train that takes guests along the lakeside and into the Franciacorta region. While they enjoy the views they also get a seven-course meal - with today's starter cooked by Gino.

programme.title: The Greek Islands with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Julia visits the lush Ionian island of Corfu, beginning in its capital, Corfu Town, where she discovers a surprising, cosmopolitan city more like a little slice of Italy than Greece. After sampling the delights of its famous mumquat flavoured ice-cream, a cookery lesson in making signature savoury dish pastitsada reveals the island's centuries-old love affair with exotic spices. Julia meets a pair of brothers passionate about revolutionising production of Corfu's oldest and most important export - olive oil- and ends her stay trying out the secret to staying young that all Corfiots swear by.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the latest round of the blind auditions in the spinning-chair singing contest, in which celebrity 'coaches' seek out the nation's best vocal talent. But there is a simple twist - with the four coaches selecting their teams through 'blind auditions', looks play no part in the selection process, meaning each singer is chosen on vocal ability alone. Meghan Trainor is the newest recruit to the judging panel, joining series regulars Olly Murs, Tom Jones and Will.i.am.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett hosts the singing contest in which a celebrity panel and a studio audience must guess the famous faces performing behind elaborate costumes. Regular panellists Rita Ora, Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall and Ken Jeong try to identify the mysterious celebrities disguised as a daisy, a fox, an octopus, a tree and a monster.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Russell Kane, Leonie Elliott, Kevin Clifton and Bonnie Langford pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds for charity. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby present as the remaining 11 celebrities and their professional partners perform routines from famous musicals. They will be hoping to get a high score from judges Jayne Torvill, Christopher Dean, Ashley Banjo and John Barrowman - not to mention plenty of viewer votes - and avoid having to compete in the skate-off.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The body of 19-year-old apprentice electrician Dennis Bayliss is discovered washed up on the shore of a North Northumberland rural estate. The victim turns out to be the estranged son of Steph and Rob Bayliss who are left crippled by his death, having lost him once already when he abandoned them to seek out his biological father, Thomas Walken, who just happens to run a salmon farm on the spot where the body was found. Vera is forced to look closer at the strained relationships of Dennis's two families in order to find the truth about his death.

programme.title: Bradley Walsh & Son: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: For the next leg of their journey, the actor and his son head to the Great Smoky Mountains on the Tennessee-North Carolina border, where they go canoeing on the iconic rapids that featured in the film Deliverance. With Bradley left in need of a whisky, they head to a Hillbilly Jam for a nightcap and to experience the mountain tradition of clog dancing, before the pair try their hand at chopping wood with some competitive lumberjacks and taking to the woods to search for a mythical mountain beast.

programme.title: The Metro: A Rail Life Story
programme.desc: Documentary following workers on the Tyne and Wear Metro - the UK's largest metro system outside of London. In the first edition, staff in Sunderland prepare for the arrival of 50,000 Spice Girls fans ahead of the pop group's concert at the Stadium of Light. The pressure rises across the day as head of operations Wayne spots a potential fault with an overhead line, and there's an anxious call to the control room - a set of fans have lost their tickets for the concert of a lifetime. Narrated by Zoe Hakin.

programme.title: Liar
programme.desc: Laura's online attack on Andrew yields unexpected consequences as a figure from her past returns to haunt her, potentially jeopardising the case. Laura resorts to extreme measures to find hard evidence of Andrew's guilt.

programme.desc: Eccentric military equipment collector Bruce Crompton and Hus head to freezing Finland following a hot tip. Up near the Arctic Circle there's a kind of Winter Wonderland of Second World War vehicles and equipment..

programme.title: Formula E
programme.desc: Action from the Santiago ePrix.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini is asked to sell six cars including a 1952 Jaguar XK 120 Roadster and a 1969 Oldsmobile 442 Coupe at the Gooding auction.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Restorer Wayne Carini hopes his '55 Ford Thunderbird will attract high bids at the Gooding auction.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that capture a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that capture a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A mansion in San Francisco is swallowed by a sinkhole, a chemical explosion occurs in America and two Russian jets collide at an air show. Presented by Ron Pitts.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Passengers are rescued from a plane crash in the Indian Ocean, a volcano threatens a town in Hawaii, and a helicopter pilot misjudges his moves at an air show.

programme.title: Goblin Works Garage
programme.desc: The gang transforms an iconic 1973 Ford Bronco into a monster truck with attitude. Plus, Ant builds a bike for his most important client: his daughter.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: Chip Foose and the team try to improve a convertible Cadillac, which has been used to house its owner's Christmas decorations.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien travel across the UK to find unique and valuable items, and their latest find is an old bureau which gets a makeover in Yorkshire.

programme.title: Supercar Superbuild
programme.desc: The production of the Pagani Huayra, an expensive, ultra-aerodynamic vehicle that has more than 700 horsepower, and a top speed higher than 230 MPH.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: On a trip to Barcelona to buy antiques Drew Pritchard uncovers an early, two-door Range Rover. In Hampshire, he and Paul Cowland disagree on how to restore a Porsche 944.

programme.title: Goblin Works Garage
programme.desc: The gang transforms an iconic 1973 Ford Bronco into a monster truck with attitude. Plus, Ant builds a bike for his most important client: his daughter.

programme.title: EFL on Quest
programme.desc: A round-up of goals and highlights from the English Football League.

programme.title: Mega Shippers
programme.desc: In Louisiana, Shane struggles to send a shipment of fuel to the UK. Meanwhile, one truck driver races across Europe to deliver a £200,000 rally car.

programme.title: Mega Shippers
programme.desc: In Texas, the process of unloading a 726-tonne column requires everyone's attention, while in London, a rail worker sends 22 train carriages of cement across the city.

programme.title: Mega Shippers
programme.desc: A 10,000-tonne oil rig is moved through shallow waters, and a flight control tower is shipped for a new Royal Navy aircraft carrier.

programme.title: Mega Shippers
programme.desc: More logistical headaches arise when one load-master stows £100million of super yacht onto a vessel carrier. Plus, an operations supervisor loads a rare three-wheeled sports car.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: King Crab season kicks off with a 12 million pound Bairdi quota increase that causes a fishing frenzy. Plus, a boat is stolen the night before launch.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer gets a good deal on a 1957 Chevrolet and Edd China performs an excellent restoration job, but their colour choice could prove to be an expensive mistake.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien travel across the UK to find unique and valuable items, and their latest find is an old bureau which gets a makeover in Yorkshire.

programme.title: Born Mucky: Life on the Farm
programme.desc: Rural crime hits Pete and Ally in Herefordshire as thieves strike before harvest. In Cambridgeshire, Tom clashes with a worker, while a huge bull poses a dilemma for farmer Ian.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: On a trip to Barcelona to buy antiques Drew Pritchard uncovers an early, two-door Range Rover. In Hampshire, he and Paul Cowland disagree on how to restore a Porsche 944.

programme.title: Goblin Works Garage
programme.desc: The gang transforms an iconic 1973 Ford Bronco into a monster truck with attitude. Plus, Ant builds a bike for his most important client: his daughter.

programme.title: The Unexplained Files
programme.desc: Investigating whether a UFO could be to blame when a pilot crashes after a collision with an unknown object. Plus, a disk is seen hovering above a Chicago airport.

programme.title: Inside Death Row with Trevor McDonald
programme.desc: Part two of two. The broadcaster interviews Fredrick Baer, who is awaiting execution at Indiana State Prison for the murders of a woman and her four-year-old daughter. Baer talks about his abusive childhood and explains what led him to a life of crime, before Trevor visits the chamber where the condemned man will one day be executed. There's also an insight into the more privileged part of the facility, where inmates stay in a dormitory with cubicles instead of cells. There, he talks to John Serwatka, who was paid to kill two innocent strangers and will never be released.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: An insight into how a murder can be solved by simple scraps of evidence such as dirt on shoes or a small piece of plastic.

programme.title: Copycat Killers
programme.desc: The case of X-Men fan Jed Allen, who regarded its character Wolverine as the hero he wanted to be. Soon, his obsession was taken too far and he could no longer accept reality.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The fatal shooting of Terri Ann McCoy on her family home's landing, by a lookout guarding fellow robbers who had invaded the building to steal jewellery in November 2009.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Law enforcement officials in Washington, DC vow to bring a gang and its leader to justice when one member kills two FBI agents.

programme.title: Animal Cops San Francisco
programme.desc: The officers reveal their most stressful, action-packed and heart-wrenching stories from the series.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown treats a Fijian dog whose nose was cut off in a hunting accident, bringing the unfortunate pooch back to Australia for major reconstructive surgery.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: Not Afraid to Try New Things
programme.desc: Excited wedding planner Rachel tries on some 'edgy' dresses. Natalie wants a unique gown, but knows her traditionally minded mother may not approve. Kleinfeld employee Subrina hopes her customised dress will match her vision.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: I'll Know It When I See It
programme.desc: Brooke is looking for a special gown - it has to be unique and she won't settle for anything else. Unfortunately, nothing seemingly lives up to her expectations.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: When E'terica's fiance questions her taste in wedding gowns, he also tests her self-esteem, while Katy's mother is not ready to let go of her daughter.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown and his team treat more creatures from the Cook Islands, including a cat that is missing part of its nose and a massive five-metre crocodile.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown heads to Victoria, where he trims the tusks of 220kg pig, tries to keep a three-legged cow on its feet and treats a dizzy dog.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Diana is a prisoner to her 620lb-body. Desperate to break free of her food addiction, she embarks on a weight loss journey, hoping to keep her food addiction in check, in order to regain control of her life.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: An update on the stories of obese Americans who set out to turn their lives around, featuring Ashley who lost over 200lbs in Houston. Can she continue it with her family of enablers? Diana has shed 300lbs, but will knee damage threaten her progress?.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride would like an azalea green dress, but her sister has different ideas. Plus, a woman tries to convince her sibling to wear a dress for the first time in 15 years.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Sibling rivalry gets in the way of a dress selection, and a soon-to-be-married woman disagrees with her brother over gown styles.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Lori tries to find a dress for a bossy bridesmaid, while Summer wants a gown that is over her budget.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Lori tries to find a gown for a group of bridesmaids who hate the wedding's colour scheme, while Leslie faces a mutiny when she struggles to pick a dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride searching for modest bridesmaid dresses falls in love with a revealing gown that reduces her mother to tears.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.sub-title: It's a Drag Being a Bridesmaid
programme.desc: Brandon tries to find a dress to complement a client's unique wedding party, including her drag queen 'bridesman'.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A woman getting married at a winery tries to convince her bridesmaids to dress in purple and green to suit her theme.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Lori seeks out the perfect dress for an insecure bridesmaid with body image issues, while Emily's insulting outbursts threaten to ruin her friendships.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride fights her mother for control of the dress choice while a military bride argues over how her maids should look.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Helena wants her eight bridesmaids to wear a different vintage dress as Lori tries to prevent the bride's vision from looking like chaos.

programme.title: Crikey! It's the Irwins
programme.desc: Terri helps determine if Caballe the rhino is pregnant, while Robert matchmakes the zoo's Aldabra giant tortoises.

programme.title: Little People, Big World
programme.desc: Dwarf mum Amy reveals how she carried and gave birth to average-sized children, as she and daughter Molly celebrate their birthdays.

programme.title: Little People, Big World
programme.desc: Twins Zach and Jeremy start high school. With one brother a dwarf and the other of average height, the experience promises to be eventful.

programme.title: Long Lost Family US
programme.desc: Jennifer is in need of some serious help and asks Lisa Joyner to help her track down her family after she was abandoned at a laundromat 50 years ago.

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: The phenomenon of high-profile criminal cases where people publically feign innocence about a crime they have committed, shedding crocodile tears in the process.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Lindsey seemed to have it all - but her food addiction threatens to ruin everything. As she startss her weight loss journey, is her husband a support or an addict?.
